This Thanksgiving, New York is bracing for significant highway congestion and a sharp temperature drop, while NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani is navigating staffing changes and potential legislative challenges amid rising concerns over immigration enforcement and public health issues.

### Risks & Alerts

- NY highways may experience heavy congestion this Thanksgiving due to increased travel. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Thanksgiving Day weather forecast predicts a significant temperature drop and strong winds. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Shots fired near Myrtle Avenue in East New York; no injuries reported. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxNRjhVMllHWmp6SGd5aGhWOWdtVWhUS2FVclVEc2NFc0J3N2pzWTl2M2U1YnBEeXdSajEwa2VJVUZQc2pWa2FPb2NjSXRQZUxaRXIzMXFodktwbVR0elNxWXNiOVVsQmNpOVdXWUZJSzdBc1FleFVRUmJ1YndPbnBpZndoVTE?oc=5)
- New flu mutation and trio of illnesses raise concerns among health experts in NY. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
